creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund and Gift of funds from Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: Celadon vase, from the yaozhou kilns; porcelain; baluster body divided into 6 lobes and vigorously carved with an overall pattern of peony scroll, trumpet neck lobed to match and flaring mouth with frilled rim; glaze of characteristic olive green tone; grayish stoneware body revealed at unglazed rim of foot.
medium: Yaozhou ware Stoneware with carved decor under celadon glaze
title: Vase
